summary: The Fairness to Freedom Act of 2025 aims to guarantee and expand the right to counsel for individuals facing removal proceedings. It establishes the Office of Immigration Representation to provide high-quality legal representation, funded through appropriations. The bill amends the Immigration and Nationality Act to ensure government-funded counsel for those who cannot afford it, covering various immigration proceedings and related matters. It also addresses waiver of counsel, access to counsel, eligibility criteria, and emphasizes the importance of providing comprehensive legal services, including access to evidence and information.
